FuncDef: The display igmp explicit-tracking command displays tracking information of IGMPv3 hosts. The display igmp explicit-tracking command displays tracking information of IGMPv3 hosts.
CLIs: display igmp explicit-tracking [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ group <group-address> [ source <source-address> ] ] ] [ [ host-address <host-address> ] verbose ]

display igmp { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } explicit-tracking [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ group <group-address> [ source <source-address> ] ] ] [ [ host-address <host-address> ] verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface type and number.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies a multicast group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.1.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a multicast source address.
The value can be a Class A, B, or C address, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a host address.
The value can be a Class A, B, or C address, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
